explanation:
self_name — global object passed to printf (format "%s"). Need its declaration/type (char * vs array vs macro) and constness to confirm it is not a hidden function parameter and that show_help does not modify any parameter via this object.

tool_copyright — global object passed to printf. As with self_name, need its type/definition to ensure it is not a parameter of show_help and that no parameter of show_help is being modified through it.

MHD_is_feature_supported — called by show_help. Its prototype/definition is needed to check whether it takes pointer parameters or is a macro/inline that could modify caller state; ensure the call cannot modify any (non-existent) parameters of show_help or provoke side-effects that would be treated as parameter modification.

MHD_NO — constant/macro used in comparisons with MHD_is_feature_supported return. Required to understand return type/value comparisons and to rule out any macros that might expand to code that modifies parameters.

MHD_FEATURE_EPOLL, MHD_FEATURE_POLL — enumerator/macros passed to MHD_is_feature_supported. Need their definitions to ensure they are simple constants (not macros with side effects) and thus cannot cause modification of show_help parameters.

printf — standard I/O function used repeatedly. The declaration/behaviour is required to confirm that the used format strings do not contain %n or other constructs that would cause modification of caller-supplied argument objects, and to verify that printf cannot modify any parameters of show_help.

Rationale summary: show_help has no formal parameters (void), so the main checks are whether any globals passed to callees or the callees themselves could entail modifying function parameters (or be macros that expand to code that modifies parameters). The listed symbols are exactly those referenced by show_help whose definitions/signatures are needed to conclude no violation of the MISRA rule.
